column4: I have Ubuntu 8.04 Live running, and I want to put 9.04 live on another USB device, but I can't get the usb-installer package
sudo apt-get install usb-installer just says it can't find hat
And manually attempting to install syslinux or grub has never worked for me
Try unetbooin
Tried it, but it won't boot--says there's some problem with ACPI in my bios and drops to a busybox shell
Are you using jaunty right now?  Go to System > Admin > USB startup
Also it's called usb-creator iirc
Yeah, that's what I was asctually trying to install, sorry
Still Couldn't find package usb-creator
you using jaunty?
Hardy
it comes along with it
usb-creator comes with 8.04?
Sry I'm wrong, it is only included in the LiveCD
sudo apt-get install usb-creator
Make sure the software-sources are activated if you are on a live cd (software sources or sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list). You may need to install the python-gnome2 package as well.
I can install any other package, including packages from universe and multiverse.  I've already got python-gnome2.  Just can't even find usb-creator.  Wow, That's Funny.
Here:  http://tr.im/y6FP
Thanks! unfortunately "Error: Dependency is not satisfiable: python-central" even though "python-central is already the newest version"
I think it's safe to say at this point that the universe hates me.
Time to upgrade to Jaunty :D
Exactly what I'm trying to do! Gaaaaah!
Install windows then :D
Actually, that's not a bad idea.  I have XP running on an old laptop; I could try the Windows LiveUSB installer on that.
